Dispute_Type: Dispute over tax assessment and administrative seizure validity
Legal_Issue: Can the Federal Court review a tax assessment issued under the Income Tax Act when an objection and appeal process exists?
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review application in Federal Court
Legal_Rule: The Federal Court lacks jurisdiction to review tax assessments under the Income Tax Act if an objection and appeal procedure is available.
Procedural_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to existence of statutory appeal process
Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to 'Requirement to Pay' issued by CCRA
Legal_Framework: Statutory objection and appeal procedures under the Income Tax Act
Applicant_Challenge: Jus d'Or Inc. challenged the tax assessment and seizure
Court_Result: Dismissed due to lack of jurisdiction
Remedy_Sought: Invalidation of tax assessment and administrative seizure
Legal_Provision_Cited: Income Tax Act - objection and appeal procedures
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction where statutory remedies exist
Applicable_Process: Objection and appeal process under the Income Tax Act
Governing_Rule: Federal Court cannot intervene when statutory appeal mechanisms are available
